intro: Canarium lobocarpum, commonly known as the Philippine candlenut tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its elliptical leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The tree produces woody capsules that contain oily seeds, which are used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Its bark and leaves are also utilized in local remedies for their purported healing properties. Canarium lobocarpum plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and soil stability.
